tit.e: Fukuro shinai (bamboo sword covered with a sleeve)

sen.j: 袋竹刀（ふくろしない）は、竹刀が考案される以前に剣術の稽古に用いられていた武道具の一種。
sen.e: Fukuro shinai (bamboo sword covered with a bag) is a tool for the martial arts that had been used in the swordsmanship training before the bamboo sword was devised.
Fukuro shinai (a kind of bamboo sword covered with a bag) is a tool used in martial arts that had been used in swordsmanship training before the bamboo sword was devised.
Fukuro shinai (written as 袋竹刀) is a tool used in martial arts that had been used in swordsmanship training before the bamboo sword was devised.
sen.cmt: 次セルでは漢字表記について言及しているため、こちらでも漢字を追加しました。

sen.j: 袋韜、袋撓とも。
sen.e: Fukuro shinai is also called "袋韜" or "袋撓."
sen.cmt: 袋韜，袋撓の読みがわかりません。
sen.e: Fukuro shinai is also called 袋韜 or 袋撓.
sen.cmt: Punctuation. If the pronunciation of both words is the same as 'fukuro shinai', the sentence should be changed to 'Fukuro Shinai can also be written 袋韜 or 袋撓.'
sen.e: Fukuro shinai is also written as 袋韜 or 袋撓.
sen.cmt: 両方とも「ふくろしない」と読むようですので、written as としました。

sen.j: 新陰流では上泉信綱が考案したと伝えられ、蟇肌竹刀とも呼ぶ。
sen.e: In Shinkage-ryu school of swordsmanship, it is believed that Nobutsuna KAMIIZUMI devised the fukuro shinai, which is also called "hikihada-shinai bamboo sword."
In the Shinkage-ryu school of swordsmanship, it is believed that Nobutsuna KAMIIZUMI devised the fukuro shinai, which is also known as "hikihada-shinai bamboo sword."
In the Shinkage-ryu school of swordsmanship, it is believed that Nobutsuna KAMIIZUMI devised the fukuro shinai, which is also known as "hikihada-shinai bamboo sword."

sen.j: 現在も新陰流、鹿島新当流、馬庭念流、小野派一刀流、寺見流など多くの剣術流派の稽古に用いられている。
sen.e: Even now, many schools of swordsmanship, such as Shinkage-ryu school, Kashima-Shintoryu school, Maniwanen-ryu school, Onohaittoryu school and Jigen-ryu school, use fukuro shinai in training.

Even now, fukuro shinai are used in training in many schools of swordsmanship, such as the Shinkage-ryu school, Kashima-Shintoryu school, Maniwanen-ryu school, Onohaittoryu school and the Jigen-ryu school.

Even now, fukuro shinai are used in training in many schools of swordsmanship, such as the Shinkage-ryu school, Kashima-Shintoryu school, Maniwanen-ryu school, Onohaitto-ryu school and the Jigen-ryu school.

sen.j: 新陰流のみは表面に赤漆を塗り鍔が無い独特な袋竹刀を用いる。
sen.e: Only Shinkage-ryu school uses a unique fukuro shinai with the red lacquer-coated surface, without a tsuba (sword guard).
The Shinkage-ryu school uses a unique fukuro shinai with a red lacquer-coated surface, without a tsuba (sword guard), the only school to do so.
The Shinkage-ryu school uses a unique fukuro shinai with a red lacquer-coated surface, without a tsuba (sword guard), the only school to do so.

sen.j: （新陰流以外では牛革や紙縒などで作った鍔を付けた物が多く用いられる）
sen.e: (Other schools except Shinkage-ryu school frequently use the fukuro shinai equipped with a tsuba made from cowhide, koyori (string made from twisted paper), and so on.)
Other schools frequently use a fukuro shinai equipped with a tsuba made from cowhide, koyori (string made from twisted paper), or other materials.
sen.cmt: Punctuation, style. Parentheses removed as too many can make the piece sound colloquial.
sen.e: Other schools frequently use a fukuro shinai equipped with a tsuba made from cowhide, koyori (string made from twisted paper), or other materials.

sen.j: 直心影流剣術でも「袋韜」という武道具を用いるが、これは一般的な袋竹刀とは異なる。
sen.e: Jikishinkage-ryu school of swordsmanship also uses a martial arts tool called '袋韜,' however, its appearance differs from that of ordinary fukuro shinai.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The Jikishinkage-ryu school of swordsmanship also uses a martial arts tool called a '袋韜,' however, its appearance differs from that of ordinary fukuro shinai.
The Jikishinkage-ryu school of swordsmanship also uses a martial arts tool called a 'fukuro shinai' (袋韜), however, its appearance differs from that of ordinary fukuro shinai.
sen.cmt: この漢字は「ふくろしない」と読むようですので、読みを追加しました。

sen.j: 鍔を外した通常の竹刀に、先端から全体の半分ほどの部分のみに革袋を被せた物である。
sen.e: The '袋韜' is made of usual bamboo sword after the tsuba was removed, and only half of its length is covered by a leather bag.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The '袋韜' is made from a standard bamboo sword with the tsuba removed, and only half of its length is covered with a leather bag.
It is made from a standard bamboo sword with the tsuba removed, and only half of its length is covered with a leather sleeve.
sen.cmt: The '袋韜' → It としました。

sen.j: 多くの流派では、一本の竹を中程まで四つに割る。
sen.e: Many schools use a bamboo as a material to make the fukuro shinai by dividing its half distal part vertically into four parts.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Many schools use bamboo as a material to make the fukuro shinai by dividing one end into four parts lengthways up to halfway.
Many schools use bamboo as a material to make the fukuro shinai by dividing one end into four parts lengthways up to halfway.

sen.j: その半ば八つ割り、その先が十六としたものへ、分厚い牛革を被せて筒状に縫い合せ、保護したもの。
sen.e: Furthermore, they divide the middle one third of the divided distal part vertically into eight parts in total and the distal one third into sixteen parts in total, applying a thick cowhide on it and sewing it cylindrically for protecting the bamboo sword.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: They then divide the middle third of the divided part vertically into eight parts and the end third into sixteen parts in total, applying a thick cowhide and sewing it into a cylinder shape in order to protect the bamboo sword.

They then divide the middle third of the divided part vertically into eight parts and the end third into sixteen parts in total, applying a thick cowhide and sewing it into a cylinder shape in order to protect the bamboo sword.

sen.j: ただし流派によって竹を割る数は違う。
sen.e: However, each school divides the bamboo into different numbers.
However, some schools divide the bamboo into a different number of parts.
However, some schools divide the bamboo into a different number of parts.

sen.j: 長さは流派によって異なる。
sen.e: Length of the fukuro shinai differs among schools.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The length of the fukuro shinai also differs among schools.
The length of the fukuro shinai also differs among schools.

sen.j: 新陰流では、革に赤漆を施して表面の劣化を防ぎ、全長を三尺三寸（小太刀一尺七寸五分）と定め、縫い目を以って刃と見立てる。
sen.e: For example, Shinkage-ryu school fixes the length at about 100cm (for kodachi (small sword), at about 53cm), coating the leather bag covering the sword with red lacquer for protecting the surface from degradation, and regarding the seam of the bag as a blade.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: For example, the Shinkage-ryu school fixes the length at about 100cm, or for kodachi (small sword) at about 53cm, coating the leather bag covering the sword with red lacquer to protect the surface from wear and tear, and with the seam of the bag with the appearance of a blade.

For example, the Shinkage-ryu school fixes the length at about 100 cm, or for kodachi (small sword) at about 53 cm, coating the leather sleeve that covers the sword with red lacquer to protect the surface from wear and tear; the seam of the sleeve is used to represent the sword's blade.
sen.cmt: 原文に合わせて訳文を修正

sen.j: 非常に軽量であり、ビニール傘よりわずかに重い程度。
sen.e: Fukuro shinai is quite light, a little heavier than vinyl umbrellas.
Fukuro shinai are quite light, weighing a little more than a vinyl umbrella.
Fukuro shinai are quite light, weighing a little more than a vinyl umbrella.

sen.j: 上に被せる革筒は、もともと遠出する武家が鞘全体へ被せて汚れや損傷などを防いだ道具（表面の皺が蟇蛙に似ていたため蟇肌と呼ばれる）から始まっている。
sen.e: The leather bag covering the sword is originated from a tool used by samurai when they went to a distant place, to protect the sheath from dirt and damage by putting the tool on the whole length of the sheath (the wrinkle on the surface of the tool resembles the skin of toad, therefore it is called hikihada (skin of toad)).

The leather sleeve covering the sword originates from a tool used by samurai when they traveled a long distance, used to protect the sheath from dirt and damage by placing the tool along the whole length of the sheath; the wrinkle on the surface of the tool resembles the skin of a toad, and as such it is called hikihada (skin of toad).

The leather sleeve covering the sword originates from a tool used by samurai when they traveled a long distance, used to protect the sheath from dirt and damage by placing the tool along the whole length of the sheath; the wrinkle on the surface of the tool resembles the skin of a toad, and as such it is called hikihada (skin of toad).

sen.j: それまでの木刀を使用した稽古（すべて仮当てだが間違えば大怪我、死亡など事故に至りかねない）とは違って、相手に本気で打ちかかることが出来た（ただし、怪我をする人はするし、かなり痛みも伴う）。
sen.e: Unlike in the training using usual wooden sword (it has a risk to cause serious injury and fatal accidents, even if trainees strike at opponents pretendedly), in the training using fukuro shinai, trainees could strike at opponents seriously (undoubtedly, some trainees may be injured, and trainees suffer from considerable pain when they are struck).

Unlike in training using regular wooden swords which have the potential to cause serious injury and even fatal accidents even if trainees strike at their opponents for practice, in training using fukuro shinai, trainees can strike at their opponents with all their might (even so, some trainees may be injured, and trainees often suffer from considerable pain when they are struck).

Unlike in training using regular wooden swords which have the potential to cause serious injury and even fatal accidents even if trainees strike at their opponents for practice, in training using fukuro shinai, trainees can strike at their opponents with all their might (even so, some trainees may be injured, and trainees often suffer from considerable pain when they are struck).

sen.j: 上泉信綱の弟子で甥の疋田景兼は、木刀を手にした相手と袋竹刀で立ち会い、連戦連勝した逸話がある。
sen.e: Kagekane HIKITA, a pupil of Nobutsuna KAMIIZUMI as well as a nephew of him, had an anecdote that he fought swordsmanship matches to win consecutive victories by using fukuro shinai with opponents who used wooden sword.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: One anecdote tells of Kagekane HIKITA, a pupil of Nobutsuna KAMIIZUMI and also his nephew, having a string of consecutive victories using a fukuro shinai against opponents who used a wooden sword.
One anecdote tells of Kagekane HIKITA, a pupil of Nobutsuna KAMIIZUMI and also his nephew, having a string of consecutive victories using a fukuro shinai against opponents who used a wooden sword.

sen.j: その際に相手を失神させる事もあったという。
sen.e: It is said that he sometimes made opponents faint.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It is said that he sometimes made opponents faint.
It is said that he sometimes made opponents faint.

sen.j: 柳生新陰流は一部の形で木刀を用いる以外、ほとんど袋竹刀を利用した形稽古を現代に伝えている。
sen.e: Yagyu Shinkage-ryu school has handed down trainings of kata (basic form and movement) by mainly using fukuro shinai to present, even if it uses wooden sword in some types of kata.
The Yagyu Shinkage-ryu school, while using a wooden sword for some types of kata (basic form and movement), has passed down to the present forms of kata training using fukuro shinai.
The Yagyu Shinkage-ryu school, while using a wooden sword for some types of kata (basic form and movement), has passed down to the present forms of kata training using fukuro shinai.

sen.j: また、馬庭念流では木刀での形稽古に習熟した後、袋竹刀と独特の防具を用いた稽古を現代も行っている。
sen.e: Moreover, Maniwanen-ryu school even now gives trainings using fukuro shinai and peculiar protectors to pupils who had already mastered the kata training using wooden sword.

Moreover, the Maniwanen-ryu school even now gives training with fukuro shinai used together with a unique form of protective tool, to pupils who have already mastered the kata training using a wooden sword.

Moreover, the Maniwanen-ryu school even now gives training with fukuro shinai used together with a unique form of protective tool, to pupils who have already mastered the kata (form) training using a wooden sword.
sen.cmt: 型→form を追加しました。

sen.j: 特に決った手入れ法はない。
sen.e: How to care the fukuro shinai is not specifically mentioned.
There is no specific way to take care of fukuro shinai.
There is no specific way to take care of fukuro shinai.

sen.j: 長く稽古を繰り返すうちに漆が斑になる。
sen.e: After fukuro shinai is used repeatedly, the lacquer covering the leather bag becomes spotted.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: After repeated use of fukuro shinai the lacquer covering the leather sleeve often becomes spotted.
After repeated use of fukuro shinai the lacquer covering the leather sleeve often becomes spotted.

sen.j: 打ち込む方向へ（刀の反りとは逆へ）反りが付いてゆく。
sen.e: Furthermore, the sword gradually warps toward the opposite direction from the original warp.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Also, being hit repeatedly, the sword gradually becomes warped in the opposite direction from its original curvature.
Also, being hit repeatedly, the sword gradually becomes warped in the opposite direction from its original curvature.

sen.j: 漆を塗り直すことにより長持ちさせることは可能である。
sen.e: Fukuro shinai would stand long use by repainting the lacquer on the leather bag.
Provided the lacquer is repainted fukuro shinai can be used for a long time.
Provided the lacquer is repainted fukuro shinai can be used for a long time.

sen.j: 製造加工業者は減少しているものの、古参の稽古生なら口伝に基いて自作できる。
sen.e: The number of manufacturing and processing companies of fukuro shinai is decreasing, however veteran trainees can make it by themselves referring the instruction passed down orally.
Even though the number of companies manufacturing fukuro shinai is decreasing, veteran trainees can make them themselves referring to instructions passed down orally.
Even though the number of companies manufacturing fukuro shinai is decreasing, veteran trainees can make them themselves referring to instructions passed down orally.
